comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The New York Times story (December 19, 1913) about the scandalous doings at the Atlantic Cat Club's 12th annual championship show, held in the Belvedere of New York's Astor Hotel, fails to mention either Miss M. Johnson or her stunning white cat, Abdullah. Interestingly, a cat named Toto was mentioned -- a cat so extraordinary that it was to be transported to England, there to be entered in an international cat fanciers' exhibition at London's Crystal Palace. (Toto probably derived its name from that of Dorothy's little dog in the Oz books -- books which were all the rage then.) query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9A05E...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Another NYT story, from five days earlier, reported the suicide (in New Jersey) of a black cat, 13 years old, on December 13, in the year 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9D07E3D61139E6... uncanny, huh?
